intro: Oreomunnea pterocarpa, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of red and purple. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a rough texture. Oreomunnea pterocarpa is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
